title: Intel MKL static library linking order (HPL installation failure)
body:
I was trying to install HPL with Intel MKL as below:

```
hpl@2.2%intel@18.0.1~openmp arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^intel-mkl@2018.1.163%intel@18.0.1~ilp64~shared threads=none arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^intel-mpi@2018.1.163%intel@18.0.1 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
```

The installation fails with the error:

```
 /gpfs-path/intel-mpi-2018.1.163/compilers_and_libraries/linux/mpi/intel64/bin/mpiicc -DAdd_ -DF77_INTEGER=int -DStringSunStyle -DHPL_DETAILED_TIMING -DHPL_PROGRESS_REPORT -I/tmp/kumbhar/spack-stage/spack-stage-9VZvqF/hpl-2.2/include -I/tmp/kumbhar/spack-stage/spack-stage-9VZvqF/hpl-2.2/include/Linux-x86_64 -I/gpfs-path/intel-mkl-2018.1.163/include -I/gpfs-path/intel-mpi-2018.1.163/include -O3  -o /tmp/kumbhar/spack-stage/spack-stage-9VZvqF/hpl-2.2/bin/Linux-x86_64/xhpl HPL_pddriver.o         HPL_pdinfo.o           HPL_pdtest.o /tmp/kumbhar/spack-stage/spack-stage-9VZvqF/hpl-2.2/lib/Linux-x86_64/libhpl.a /gpfs-path/intel-mkl-2018.1.163/compilers_and_libraries/linux/mkl/lib/intel64/libmkl_intel_lp64.a /gpfs-path/intel-mkl-2018.1.163/compilers_and_libraries/linux/mkl/lib/intel64/libmkl_core.a /gpfs-path/intel-mkl-2018.1.163/compilers_and_libraries/linux/mkl/lib/intel64/libmkl_sequential.a -L/gpfs-path/intel-mpi-2018.1.163/lib
/gpfs-path/intel-mkl-2018.1.163/compilers_and_libraries/linux/mkl/lib/intel64/libmkl_sequential.a(d__trsm_seq.o): In function `mkl_blas_dtrsm':
_trsm.c:(.text+0x4c): undefined reference to `mkl_blas_xdtrsm'
/gpfs-path/intel-mkl-2018.1.163/compilers_and_libraries/linux/mkl/lib/intel64/libmkl_sequential.a(d__gemm_seq.o): In function `mkl_blas_dgemm':
_gemm.c:(.text+0x13c): undefined reference to `mkl_serv_cpu_detect'
_gemm.c:(.text+0x283): undefined reference to `mkl_blas_xdgemm'
_gemm.c:(.text+0x3f4): undefined reference to `mkl_serv_allocate'
_gemm.c:(.text+0x473): undefined reference to `mkl_serv_deallocate
```

If we look at the order of libraries suggested by [intel-mkl-link-line-advisor](https://software.intel.com/en-us/articles/intel-mkl-link-line-advisor), it looks like:

```
 ${MKLROOT}/lib/intel64/libmkl_scalapack_lp64.a -Wl,--start-group ${MKLROOT}/lib/intel64/libmkl_cdft_core.a ${MKLROOT}/lib/intel64/libmkl_intel_lp64.a ${MKLROOT}/lib/intel64/libmkl_sequential.a ${MKLROOT}/lib/intel64/libmkl_core.a ${MKLROOT}/lib/intel64/libmkl_blacs_intelmpi_lp64.a
```

So the `libmkl_core.a` should appear after `libmkl_sequential.a.
